entry.title: The Housing Benefit (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Housing Benefit and Council Tax Benefit (Decisions and Appeals) Regulations 2001, the Housing Benefit Regulations 2006 (“the Housing Benefit Regulations”) and the Housing Benefit (Persons who have attained the qualifying age for state pension credit) Regulations 2006.

entry.title: The St George’s Healthcare National Health Service Trust (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order transfers, under paragraph 10(3) of Schedule 4 to the National Health Service Act 2006, trust property held by St George’s Healthcare National Health Service Trust to the trustee appointed for that Trust under the National Health Service Trusts (Trust Funds: Appointment of Trustee) Order 2000 (as amended) and makes related provision. A copy of the schedule of trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The HGV Road User Levy Act 2013 (Commencement No.1) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order commences sections 11 and 13 of the HGV Road User Levy Act 2013 (“2013 Act”) for the purpose of exercising certain powers under the Road Traffic Offenders Act 1988 (“1988 Act”). In particular, the commencement of these sections of the 2013 Act enable the Secretary of State to make Orders under the 1988 Act which will—

entry.title: The Vale of Pickering Internal Drainage Board Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order confirms a Scheme submitted by the Environment Agency making provision for—

entry.title: The Local Authorities (Standing Orders) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Local Authorities (Standing Orders) (England) Regulations 2001 which require certain local authorities in England to make or modify standing orders so that they include certain provisions relating to staff and other matters.

title.div: The School Standards and Organisation (Wales) Act 2013 (Commencement No. 4 and Savings Provisions) Order 2014 / Gorchymyn Deddf Safonau a Threfniadaeth Ysgolion (Cymru) 2013 (Cychwyn Rhif 4 a Darpariaethau Arbed) 2014

div.p: This is the fourth commencement order made by the Welsh Ministers under the School Standards and Organisation (Wales) Act 2013 (“the 2013 Act”). This Order brings into force on 20 February 2014 the following provisions of the 2013 Act:

entry.title: The NHS Bodies (Transfer of Trust Property) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order transfers to the relevant new NHS bodies property held on trust by the relevant old NHS bodies and makes related provision. Copies of the schedules of trust property transferred under this Order can be obtained from the Department of Health, Quarry House, Quarry Hill, Leeds LS2 7UE.

entry.title: The Special Educational Needs (Direct Payments) (Pilot Scheme) (Extension and Amendment) Order 2014

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Special Educational Needs (Direct Payments) (Pilot Scheme) (Extension and Amendment) Order 2014

entry.summary: This Order amends the Special Educational Needs (Direct Payments) (Pilot Scheme) Order 2012 (“the 2012 Order”).

entry.title: The Prisons and Young Offenders Institutions (Scotland) Amendment Rules 2014
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Prisons and Young Offenders Institutions (Scotland) Rules 2011 (“the Prison Rules”). Rule 2(a) amends Schedule 2 to the Prison Rules to remove the entries for HMP Aberdeen and HMP Peterhead from the table. Rule 2(b) amends Schedule 2 to the Prison Rules to insert a new entry for HMP Grampian into the table.

entry.title: The Criminal Justice (Electronic Monitoring) (Responsible Person) Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order amends the Criminal Justice (Sentencing) (Programme and Electronic Monitoring Requirements) Order 2005 (S.I. 2005/963), the Bail (Electronic Monitoring of Requirements) (Responsible Officer) Order 2008 (S.I. 2008/2713), the Criminal Justice (Sentencing) (Curfew Condition) Order 2008 (S.I. 2008/2768) and the Youth Rehabilitation Order (Electronic Monitoring Requirement) Order 2009 (S.I. 2009/2950).

entry.title: The Heavy Fuel Oil (Amendment) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations implement Article 30 of Directive 2012/18/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council on the control of major accident hazards involving dangerous substances (O.J. No. L 197, 24.7.2012, p.1) (the “Seveso III Directive”).

entry.title: The Clergy Discipline (Amendment) Rules 2013 (Appointed Day) Instrument 2014
entry.summary: This instrument brings into force on 1st February 2014 the provisions of the Clergy Discipline (Amendment) Rules 2013 which amend the Clergy Discipline Rules 2005. The Clergy Discipline Rules 2005 provide a code of procedure for the determination under the Clergy Discipline Measure 2003 of formal complaints alleging misconduct against a clerk in Holy Orders other than in relation to matters involving doctrine, ritual or ceremonial.

entry.title: The Clergy Discipline Appeal(Amendment) Rules 2013 (Appointed Day) Instrument 2014
entry.summary: This instrument brings into force on 1st February 2014 the provisions of the Clergy Discipline Appeal (Amendment) Rules 2013 which amend the Clergy Discipline Appeal Rules 2005. The Clergy Discipline Appeal Rules 2005 provide a code of procedure for appeals made pursuant to section 20 of the Clergy Discipline Measure 2003 in proceedings alleging misconduct against a clerk in Holy Orders, other than in relation to matters involving doctrine, ritual or ceremonial.

entry.title: The Clergy Discipline (Amendment) Measure 2013 (Appointed Day No. 2) Instrument 2014
entry.summary: This Instrument brings into force, on 1st February 2014, all those provisions of the Clergy Discipline (Amendment) Measure 2013 which have not previously been brought into force. The Clergy Discipline Measure 2003, sections 3 and 7 of the Ecclesiastical Jurisdiction Measure 1963, and section 10 of the Ecclesiastical Jurisdiction Measure 1986.

entry.title: Police Service of Northern Ireland and Police Service of Northern Ireland Reserve pensions (Amendment) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Royal Ulster Constabulary Pensions Regulations 1988 and the Police Pension (Northern Ireland) Regulations 2009 in order to increase the rates of contribution payable by members of the police pension schemes governed by those Regulations.

entry.title: The Charities (2008 Act) (Commencement No. 5) Order (Northern Ireland) 2014
entry.summary: This Order brings into operation provisions of the Charities Act (Northern Ireland) 2008 relating to annual returns by charities and certain other matters.

entry.title: The Self-directed Support (Direct Payments) (Scotland) Regulations 2014
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under section 15 of the Social Care (Self-directed Support) (Scotland) Act 2013 (“the Act”) and make further provision about direct payments.

entry.title: The Football Spectators (2014 World Cup Control Period) Order 2014

ukm:Subject.Value: SPORTS GROUNDS AND SPORTING EVENTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SPORTS GROUNDS AND SPORTING EVENTS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: This Order prescribes the control period under the Football Spectators Act 1989 (“the Act”) for the 2014 FIFA (Fédération Internationale de Football Association) World Cup in Brazil. The control period begins on 2nd June 2014, which is ten days before the first match in the tournament, and ends when the last match in the tournament is finished or cancelled. The last match is due to be played on 13th June 2014.

entry.title: The Welfare Benefits Up-rating Order 2014
entry.summary: This Order is made under the Welfare Benefits Up-rating Act 2013 (“the Up-rating Act”) which provides for the up-rating of certain social security benefits and payments in various tax years.

entry.title: The Civil Legal Aid (Merits Criteria) (Amendment) Regulations 2014

ukm:Subject.Value: LEGAL AID AND ADVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Civil Legal Aid (Merits Criteria) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2013

category.term: LEGAL AID AND ADVICE, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Civil Legal Aid (Merits Criteria) Regulations 2013 (S.I. 2013/104) (“the Merits Criteria Regulations”), which make provision for the criteria which the Director of Legal Aid Casework (“the Director”) must apply when determining whether an individual or legal person qualifies for civil legal services under Part 1 of the Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012 (c. 10) (“the Act”).
